Title: Amulet of Taweret
Description: Upper part of the upright standing hippopotamus goddess Taweret. Taweret was a protective goddess, especially for pregnant women, childbirth, and newborn children.
Provenance: Dikran Kelekian, New York and Paris [date and mode of acquisition unknown] (?); Henry Walters, Baltimore, 1925 (?) [mode of acquisition unknown];  Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Egyptian
Images: CUR_42.219_Back_DD_RS2009.jpg, CUR_42.219_Fnt_DD_RS2009.jpg, CUR_42.219_Lft_DD_RS2009.jpg, CUR_42.219_Rt_DD_RS2009.jpg, CUR_42.219_Top_DD_RS2009.jpg, PL7_42.219_NF_3846-tms.jpg
